data.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
data.description: A classic Roman pasta dish.
instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted water.
Fry pancetta until crispy.
Mix eggs with cheese.
Combine everything and serve.

data.name: Authentic Spaghetti Carbonara
data.description: A classic Roman pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, and pancetta.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti.
While pasta cooks, dice pancetta and cook in a skillet until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated cheese.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water, then drain pasta.
Remove skillet from heat, add pasta to pancetta.
Quickly stir in egg mixture, adding pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Season generously with black pepper and serve immediately.

data.name: Pizza Margherita
data.description: Simple pizza with tomato and cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F.
Roll out dough.
Add sauce and cheese.
Bake for 12-15 minutes.
Top with basil.

author: Chef Paolo
notes: Enhanced with better ingredients and technique

data.name: Pizza Margherita
data.description: Simple and delicious pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and fresh basil.
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread crushed tomatoes over dough, leaving a border.
Tear mozzarella and distribute over sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until crust is golden.
Top with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

author: Chef Francesca
notes: Added San Marzano tomatoes for authentic flavor

data.name: Pizza Margherita
data.description: Authentic Neapolitan pizza with San Marzano tomatoes, buffalo mozzarella, and fresh basil.
instructions: Preheat oven to 500°F (260°C) with pizza stone inside.
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface to 12-inch diameter.
Spread San Marzano tomatoes over dough, leaving 1-inch border.
Tear buffalo mozzarella into pieces and distribute evenly.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil, season with sea salt and black pepper.
Transfer to preheated pizza stone and bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and bubbly.
Remove from oven and immediately top with fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with more olive oil and serve hot.

data.name: Pad Thai
data.description: Classic Thai noodle dish.
instructions: Soak noodles in water.
Make sauce with fish sauce, tamarind, and sugar.
Stir-fry shrimp and eggs.
Add noodles and sauce.
Top with peanuts and bean sprouts.

author: Chef Niran
notes: Improved with detailed measurements and technique

data.name: Pad Thai
data.description: Thailand's famous stir-fried noodle dish with a perfect balance of sweet, sour, and savory.
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 20 minutes.
Mix fish sauce, tamarind paste, and sugar for the sauce.
Heat wok, scramble eggs and set aside.
Stir-fry shrimp or tofu until cooked.
Add drained noodles and sauce, toss until coated.
Add eggs back, stir in bean sprouts.
Serve with peanuts, lime, and green onions.

data.name: Tonkotsu Ramen
data.description: Japanese pork bone broth ramen.
instructions: Simmer pork bones for hours.
Cook noodles.
Prepare toppings.
Assemble bowls and serve.

data.name: Tonkotsu Ramen
data.description: Rich, creamy Japanese pork bone broth with tender noodles and toppings.
instructions: Simmer pork bones for 12 hours to create rich broth (or use 2 hours with pressure cooker).
Strain broth and season with soy sauce and sesame oil.
Cook ramen noodles according to package directions.
Prepare soft-boiled eggs and slice pork belly.
Grill pork belly until crispy.
Assemble bowls with noodles, pour hot broth over them.
Top with pork belly, soft-boiled eggs, green onions, and nori.
Serve immediately while hot.

data.name: Chocolate Lava Cake
data.description: Individual chocolate cakes with molten center.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Melt chocolate and butter.
Mix eggs with sugar.
Combine and add flour.
Pour into ramekins and bake 12 minutes.

author: Chef Pierre
notes: Refined technique for perfect molten center

data.name: Chocolate Lava Cake
data.description: Decadent individual chocolate cakes with a molten center.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Melt chocolate and butter together.
Whisk eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until thick.
Fold in melted chocolate mixture.
Sift in flour and fold gently.
Grease ramekins with butter and dust with cocoa powder.
Pour batter into ramekins, filling 3/4 full.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are set but center is soft.
Let cool for 1 minute, then invert onto plates.
Serve immediately with ice cream or whipped cream.

data.name: New York Cheesecake
data.description: Creamy cheesecake with graham cracker crust.
instructions: Make crust with graham crackers and butter.
Beat cream cheese with sugar.
Add eggs and vanilla.
Pour over crust and bake 60 minutes.
Cool and refrigerate.

data.name: Buddha Bowl
data.description: Healthy bowl with quinoa and vegetables.
instructions: Cook quinoa.
Roast sweet potato and chickpeas.
Prepare kale.
Make tahini dressing.
Assemble bowl.

author: Chef Noah
notes: Enhanced with detailed preparation and dressing recipe

data.name: Buddha Bowl
data.description: Nutritious bowl with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and tahini dressing.
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions.
Toss sweet potato cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast sweet potato at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes.
In the last 10 minutes, add chickpeas to the baking sheet.
Massage kale with a bit of lemon juice and olive oil.
Make tahini dressing by mixing tahini, lemon juice, and water.
Assemble bowls with quinoa as base.
Top with roasted vegetables, kale, and avocado.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and serve.

data.name: Grilled Salmon
data.description: Heart-healthy grilled salmon.
instructions: Season salmon.
Grill salmon 4-5 minutes per side.
Grill asparagus.
Serve with lemon.

author: Chef Liam
notes: Enhanced with herbs and detailed grilling technique

data.name: Grilled Salmon with Asparagus
data.description: Heart-healthy grilled salmon with roasted asparagus and lemon.
instructions: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season salmon with salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
Drizzle salmon with olive oil.
Trim asparagus and toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill salmon skin-side down for 4-5 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 3-4 minutes until done.
Grill asparagus for 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve salmon and asparagus with lemon wedges and fresh dill.

data.name: Grilled Salmon with Asparagus
data.description: Heart-healthy grilled salmon with honey-mustard glaze, roasted asparagus, and lemon.
instructions: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Mix honey and Dijon mustard to make glaze.
Season salmon with salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
Brush salmon with honey-mustard glaze.
Drizzle salmon with olive oil.
Trim asparagus and toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill salmon skin-side down for 4-5 minutes.
Brush with more glaze, flip and cook for another 3-4 minutes until done.
Grill asparagus for 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve salmon and asparagus with lemon wedges and fresh dill.

data.name: Mac and Cheese
data.description: Creamy comfort food.
instructions: Cook macaroni.
Make cheese sauce with butter, flour, milk, and cheese.
Mix pasta with sauce.
Serve hot.

author: Chef Michael
notes: Enhanced with multiple cheeses and optional baking

data.name: Creamy Mac and Cheese
data.description: The ultimate comfort food with a rich, creamy cheese sauce.
instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions, drain.
In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Whisk in flour to create a roux, cook for 1 minute.
Gradually add milk, whisking constantly until smooth.
Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened.
Remove from heat and stir in cheeses until melted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add cooked macaroni and stir to coat.
Optional: Transfer to baking dish, top with breadcrumbs, and broil until golden.

data.name: Chicken Soup
data.description: Warming soup with chicken and vegetables.
instructions: Boil chicken in broth.
Add vegetables.
Add noodles.
Serve hot.

data.name: Homemade Chicken Soup
data.description: Warming chicken soup with vegetables and noodles.
instructions: In a large pot, add chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add chicken breast, reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove chicken, shred it, and set aside.
In the same pot, add carrots, celery, onion, and garlic.
Add bay leaves and simmer for 15 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Add egg noodles and cook according to package directions.
Return shredded chicken to the pot.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove bay leaves and garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

data.name: Cheese Quesadilla
data.description: Quick quesadilla with melted cheese.
instructions: Heat skillet.
Place tortilla, add cheese.
Top with second tortilla.
Cook until golden on both sides.
Cut and serve.

author: Chef Maria
notes: Added optional fillings and serving suggestions

data.name: Cheese Quesadilla
data.description: Quick and easy quesadilla with melted cheese and optional fillings.
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Place one tortilla in the skillet.
Sprinkle cheese evenly over the tortilla.
Add any optional fillings if desired.
Top with second tortilla.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until bottom is golden.
Flip and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Remove from heat and cut into wedges.
Serve with sour cream and salsa.

data.name: Veggie Omelette
data.description: Simple omelette with vegetables.
instructions: Beat eggs.
Cook vegetables in butter.
Add eggs and cook.
Add cheese and fold.
Serve.

author: Chef Antoine
notes: Enhanced with proper technique and measurements

data.name: Veggie Omelette
data.description: Fluffy omelette filled with fresh vegetables.
instructions: Beat eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Heat butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add bell peppers and mushrooms, sauté for 2 minutes.
Pour egg mixture over vegetables.
Cook without stirring until edges start to set.
Gently lift edges to let uncooked egg flow underneath.
When almost set, sprinkle cheese on one half.
Fold omelette in half and cook for another minute.
Slide onto plate and serve immediately.
